column5: Hello all,  One of my best fishing buddies is getting hitched this year and I have taken on the challenge of planning the bachelor party. The only guidance the unlucky fellow has provided is that it must involve fishing!  Almost all of the men in attendance are serious fisherman and we are less interested in partying (during the day at least)  and more interested in spending some quality time on the water. There is a total of 6-7 men and I thought it would be a great idea to book a charter on Lake St Clair to chase some muskies.  A quick google search revealed a few charter options but it seems most of them are on the states side. I could use some help if anyone can recommend a charter company based on the Ontario side that may be able to accommodate us?  Any recommendations are welcome.  Thanks in advance,
Mike Parker 100% if he'll do it...Mr handlebarz know his way around that lake pretty good!
I think Jeremy Brooks could be an option?
Can't help on charters but for lodging there is a motel in Mitchels bay that has rooms with a bunch of bunk beds in it, beers and food next door or stay in a Windsor and party on Ouelette street
get ahold of mike parker,handlebarz, or pond predator nick obermok. both very qualified,and reasonable..

Pond predator, Rampage, Drifter2, Can-Am,...those are the ones with good reputation for lots of fish and a big enough boat to handle 6-7 guys...  Not knocking Mike from handlebarz but i think he only offers small groups and likely casting...
handlebarz offers multi boat trips if folks don't know.. and fun hands on fishing.
Belle River Yaht Club is a nice place. Been there a couple times. Right on the river with a launch and parking. About a half hour drive to Windsor if you're looking for a place to party.

Hi Wabusk, welcome aboard OFC. A Musky charter bachelors party!!! You party animals. I hear the fishing is good in Vegas that time of year. But I have heard what happens on LSC stays on LSC.  But seriously for a second I have heard nothing but good things about Mike Handlebars. You will have to let us know all the wild details if you come back in 1 piece.
Didn't know that!  handlebarz offers multi boat trips if folks don't know.. and fun hands on fishing.

Hi guys,  Thank you for all the incredibly useful responses. I have been in touch with a few operators including Mike at Handlebarz. He seems like a great guy and Im currently working on finalizing the dates with him.  Again thanks for the help!  Nick
